intro: Chaetocarpus parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved hairy seagrass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Posidoniaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically found in clusters. This plant thrives in shallow coastal waters and is often found in seagrass meadows, contributing to marine biodiversity. Its root system helps stabilize sediments, playing a vital role in coastal ecosystems. Chaetocarpus parvifolius is an important species for both ecological and commercial purposes.
